channel.description: Recent content in Life Kit on SWIEST - Transcripts · Screenplays · Lyrics

item.title: Build your chosen family | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Some queer and trans people may experience rejection from their families after coming out. And so instead, they may have a chosen family: a loving network of friends and other nonbiological kin. Daniel Blevins, founder of Stand In Pride, an organization that helps LGBTQI people create relationships with parent figures, explains how to find friends you can lean on for support. Transcript

item.title: Dear Life Kit: My folks guilt-trip me into spending the holidays with them | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Between long-held traditions, unfair expectations and clashing personalities, the holidays can be a perfect storm for conflict. Therapist John Kim helps untangle three holiday conundrums. Transcript

item.title: How to minimize family fights during the holidays | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Is your aunt asking too many personal questions? Is your cousin talking your ear off about politics? These coping techniques can help you navigate sticky social situations at family holiday parties. Transcript

item.title: The decluttering philosophy that can help you keep your home organized | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Got piles of stuff you just can’t seem to get rid of? Professional organizer Star Hansen explains how to let go of unnecessary items – and keep your home neat and tidy. Transcript

item.title: Amp up your gift-giving game | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Searching for the perfect gift for a loved one doesn’t have to be stressful. With some clever thinking, buying a present can be even more fun than receiving one. ‘SELF magazine’ editor-in-chief Rachel Wilkerson Miller shares her best tips for the holidays, birthdays or any other occasion. This episode was originally published on February 2, 2023. Transcript

item.title: How to relieve constipation | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Haven’t pooped in days? Gastroenterologists explain what to do in this SOS moment — and share tips on how to avoid chronic constipation. This episode was originally published July 10, 2023. Transcript

item.title: First time decorating for the holidays? Here's where to begin | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Designer Elaine Griffin explains her philosophy when it comes to decking the halls for Christmas, Hanukkah and all your winter festivities: Begin the process with intention — and don’t be afraid to depart from tradition. Transcript

item.title: How to combat loneliness | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description 1 in 4 adults says they’re lonely. The consequences of long-term social disconnection can be dire — everything from an increased risk of heart attacks to dementia and premature death. Primary care physician and author of the new book Project UnLonely Dr. Jeremy Nobel offers tips to feel less lonely and open up to connection again. Transcript

item.title: Make the most of your chilly outdoor workouts | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description How cold is too cold? What kind of gear should you wear? And how do you stay motivated to workout outside when the weather is dreary? Cold-loving runners and a doctor share their advice to get moving during the winter. This episode originally published January 19, 2023 Transcript

item.title: Kids and firearm safety | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Firearms are the No. 1 cause of death for children and teens in the U.S. Take these life-saving precautions to protect kids — whether or not you own a gun. Transcript

item.title: 5 questions to ask your partner for a healthy, lasting marriage | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description These conversation starters get at the heart of your values, including how you deal with conflict, your attitude toward gender roles and your relationship with money. Transcript

item.title: How to donate to a charity with purpose and intention | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Not sure which cause to support or how much to give? Kevin Scally of Charity Navigator has some advice to help you make the right decisions. Transcript

item.title: Giving thanks is good for you. Here's how to make it a habit | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Being thankful doesn’t have to happen just once a year. Creating a daily gratitude habit can improve our mental and physical health. This episode, ways to be grateful all year long. This episode originally published November 21, 2022. Transcript

item.title: Create a ritual to honor your ancestors | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Your ancestors don’t have to feel like a distant memory. In this episode, spiritual practitioners and Indigenous educators offer cross-cultural guidance on how to set up a special place to honor them. Plus, how to dig into genealogical records. Transcript

item.title: Ready to cold plunge? We dive into the science to see if it's worth it | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Dipping in cold water is a growing trend. It’s not just for the thrill — people who cold plunge say it helps with anxiety, metabolic health and more. But is there science to support those claims? Transcript

item.title: A beginner's guide to roasting a Thanksgiving turkey | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description If you roast your turkey on a pre-heated pizza stone, you can avoid the dreaded task of flipping the piping hot bird midway through the cooking process, says Lan Lam of ‘America’s Test Kitchen.’ Transcript

item.title: Find a bra that actually fits | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Can’t wait to take your bra off at the end of every day? Laura Henny, a bra fitter and owner of The Rack Shack, shares tips for finding a bra that fits correctly and makes you feel comfortable and cute. Transcript

item.title: What to do if your flight gets delayed or canceled this holiday season | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description But if you have to, here’s some advice. Scott Keyes, the founder of the travel site Going.com (formerly Scott’s Cheap Flights), shares the best days to fly and what to do if your flight gets delayed. Transcript

item.title: How to ditch the apps and date offline | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Tired of swiping through dating profiles on your phone? Maybe it’s time to get out there and meet people in real life. A sexuality and relationship educator shares advice about how to meet new people, strike up conversations and move on from a love interest if the vibe isn’t there. Transcript

item.title: Protect yourself from scams | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Scams can happen to anyone. Experts explain how to safeguard your data and money from being exploited or stolen by fraudsters. Transcript

item.title: How to build low-waste practices into your life | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description The average American generates five pounds of trash per day, according to the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency. Reduce your household trash by listing your output and taking these simple actions. Transcript

item.title: How screens are changing our eyes | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Myopia, or nearsightedness, is on the rise in children as a result of reduced time outside and screen usage. TED Radio Hour host Manoush Zomorodi talks to Maria Liu, an optometrist, about how to slow down this progression and how adults can protect their eyes, too. Transcript

item.title: Dear LK: My kids are enemies. What should I do? | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description ​A sister relentlessly picks on her brother despite their mom’s best attempt to make peace between them. Psychologist Becky Kennedy shares advice with a parent who feels out of ideas — and patience. Transcript

item.title: Demystifying your health insurance plan | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description It’s open enrollment season, meaning it’s time to pick a health care plan. But it can be confusing to decipher all the acronyms and lingo of health care — so how do you pick the right health care plan for you? This episode, we break down commonly used terms and offer a strategy to help crunch the numbers. Transcript

item.title: It's soup season! Get cooking with these tips from Sohla El-Waylly | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Soup can be a flexible, cozy meal that allows you to experiment in the kitchen. But to make a delicious one, you need to get some fundamentals down first. Chef Sohla El-Waylly offers her best tips on everything from creating a yummy broth to ensuring you get your cook time right. Transcript

item.title: How to save a life with CPR | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Every year, more than 350,000 people go into cardiac arrest outside of a hospital setting in the United States. CPR, or cardiopulmonary resuscitation, can help double or triple survival rates. In this episode, we’ll explain the basics of this emergency procedure so you can feel empowered to help in a life-or-death situation. Transcript

item.title: Anxious about public speaking? We've got tips | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description It can be anxiety-inducing to deliver a speech in front of an audience. How do you capture people’s attention? What do you do if you stumble? A speechwriter and a speech coach share their best tips. Transcript

item.title: Live with your parents? Here's how to create a harmonious household | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Three people who’ve spent time living with their parents as adults share advice on how they’ve coped with their situation. Don’t compare yourself to others, they say — and find ways to still live your life. Transcript

item.title: A shame-free guide to digging out of debt | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Life happens, and so does debt. Unexpected car trouble, the high price of food, a family emergency — there is no shortage of reasons why debt can pile up. In this episode, we offer shame-free solutions for digging out of debt. This episode originally published on April 11, 2023. Transcript

item.title: Boo! Halloween is coming. Here's how to decide on a costume | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Haven’t figured out your costume yet? Don’t sweat. Stylist Sophie Strauss explains how to create a Halloween outfit that’s unexpected, fun and won’t break the bank. Transcript

item.title: How to get the most out of your library | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Baking pans, legal help, language classes and more — libraries can provide so much more than books. See if your local branch offers these free or discounted resources and services. Transcript

item.title: How to talk to kids about the violence in Israel and Gaza | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Last weekend, militants from the terrorist group Hamas killed more than a thousand people, including children, in an attack on Israel while also taking hostages. Israel has ordered a full siege of Gaza, where nearly half of residents are under 18 years of age. The news is alarming for anyone — especially for children, who may be left grappling with questions about why other children are among those affected, and whether they are safe.

item.title: How to actively heal from an injury or illness | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description If you’re recuperating after an illness or injury, it’s normal to not feel like yourself. Your body needs time to heal so you can get back to your regular activities. Physician Gavin Francis shares practical tips on active healing, deciding which activities to spend your energy on, and pacing yourself while still testing your limits. Transcript

item.title: Can I afford to totally change my life? | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Longing to quit your job and follow your passion? Or perhaps take a break to travel? Or move to a new place? First, you’ll need to look at your finances. In this episode, Jill Schlesinger, a certified financial planner and business analyst for CBS News, walks through her five steps for assessing your financial situation before a possible life change. This episode was originally published on February 28, 2023.

item.title: Dear Life Kit: Your most petty social dilemmas, answered | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Lunch snubs, bad neighbors and needy in-laws. Advice columnist R. Eric Thomas responds to the bad behavior getting under your skin. Transcript

item.title: 6 big purchases that can save energy and money at home | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description To live a more climate friendly life, invest in home appliances and vehicles that run on electricity, not fossil fuels, say sustainability experts. Here are a few energy-saving solutions to consider. Transcript

item.title: The new rules of laundry | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Patric Richardson, host of ‘The Laundry Guy’ on HGTV, wants you to change the way you wash your clothes. Go ahead and wash those darks in warm water — and embrace the express cycle. Transcript

item.title: What to know if you're exploring non-monogamy | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description When we think about romance, many of us have a specific script in mind. Two people date, fall in love and get married. But that traditional path doesn’t work for everyone. Transcript

item.title: Teeth: an owner's manual | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Brush twice a day. Remember to floss. Visit the dentist twice a year. We know the drill…or maybe not? In this episode, how to take care of your teeth, from finding a good dentist, to home teeth whitening, to the best brushing techniques. This episode originally published on February 27, 2023. Transcript

item.title: How to talk to your parents about their money | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description There comes a time when it’s the kid’s turn to take care of mom and dad. Here’s how to broach this sensitive subject with your parents. Transcript

item.title: Ace Your Freshman Year of College | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Congratulations! You’ve been accepted into college. Now you’ve got to find your way around campus, pick out classes, make new friends, and figure out a plan to graduate — on time. Here’s how to make it easier. This episode originally published on September 3, 2019. Transcript

item.title: We've heard we need more fiber in our diets. Here are 8 easy tips for getting there | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description NPR’s Maria Godoy is a self-proclaimed fiber fanatic. She explains how to add fiber to your diet (munch on popcorn!) and provides a grocery list of high-fiber foods that you can print out at home. Transcript

item.title: The consequences of overindulging your kids | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Giving in to your kid too much can be harmful to their development. Take the ‘Test of Four’ to examine your relationship with your child — then find out how to say ’no’ and enforce rules that stick. Transcript

item.title: What to know about the new COVID boosters | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Updated versions of the mRNA vaccines roll out this week. Experts say they offer good protection against current COVID variants. Who should get them, and when’s the best time to roll up your sleeve? Transcript

item.title: How to avoid 'lifestyle creep' | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Making more money tends to lead to spending more money. It’s a phenomenon known as “lifestyle creep.” Paco de Leon, author of Finance for the People, shares advice on keeping your long-term financial goals in check and fending off the subconscious urge to automatically increase spending when your income increases. This episode originally published on July 14, 2022. Transcript

item.title: Scarfing down your food? Here's how to slow down and eat more mindfully | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Lilian Cheung, a mindful eating lecturer at Harvard, shares helpful tips on how to slow down while eating — including saying ‘The 5 Contemplations’ by Buddhist master Thích Nhất Hanh. Transcript

item.title: Dear Life Kit: My husband shuts down any time I try to talk about our finances | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description I’m struggling to get my husband to make a family budget with me. Whenever the topic comes up, he completely gets defensive. How do I get him to talk to me about money? Transcript

item.title: Stomp, scrape, repeat: What you can do to stop the spotted lanternfly | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description An entomologist shares surprising insights about the invasive bug, which is wreaking havoc on crops and trees across 14 U.S. states. Plus: A poster with our facts that you can print out at home. Transcript

item.title: Don't 'get' art? You may be looking at it wrong | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Art professionals explain how to look at paintings and sculptures like an expert — and how to make the most out of a museum visit. This episode originally published January 10, 2023. Transcript

item.title: Prenups aren't just for the rich and famous. Here's when to consider one | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Everyone should consider a prenuptial agreement before getting married, says family law attorney Theresa Viera. Here’s how to talk about it with your partner and decide whether it’s right for you. Transcript

item.title: Student loan repayment is resuming. Here's what you need to know | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description The three-year federal pause on student loans is expiring soon. If your financial circumstances have changed, or you just need an explanation of the many payment plans out there, here’s a refresher course on how to pay off your student debt. Transcript

item.title: Start cleaning your home more sustainably with these tips | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Environmentally-friendly living isn’t an all-or-nothing equation: think of it as a spectrum of greens. Wherever you fall on that spectrum, green cleaning is one easy way to dip your toe into the green living waters. These tips will help you get started. This episode originally published July 11, 2022. Transcript

item.title: A guide to forest bathing | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Spending time in the forest isn’t just enjoyable, it’s good for your health. Here are some research-backed exercises to try the next time you find yourself under a canopy of trees. Transcript

item.title: When is it OK to lie? | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description When are white lies harmless or hurtful? Experts weigh in on when it’s appropriate to tell a lie, explain how lying can lead to more lying and share tips for cutting back if you want to break the habit. Transcript

item.title: Meal prep made easy | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description What’s for dinner? It’s a question that can lead to overspending on delivery, unhealthy meals and dread. FitMenCook founder Kevin Curry shares meal prep techniques that can alleviate stress and save money. This episode originally published January 31, 2023. Transcript

item.title: Protect your hearing and ears | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Go easy on the Q-tips. Watch your phone volume. And if you’re experiencing hearing issues like muffled sounds or tinnitus, see a professional. This comic offers advice on how to care for your ears. Transcript

item.title: Start a financial self-care routine | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description We’re supposed to do things routinely for our health, like brushing our teeth, showering and exercising. And there are basic hygiene tasks to maintain your financial health too. Here are five tasks to tackle each year. Transcript

item.title: The 5-minute playtime ritual that can help your kids listen | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Children’s health professionals widely recommend a strategy known as ‘special time’ to help reduce behavioral issues in young children. This episode explains how to do it and why this simple and free tool is so powerful. Transcript

item.title: Start learning your family's language | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Heritage language learners are different from people learning a second language for the first time. They often grow up hearing it, but that can come with its own set of challenges. Experts offer their advice on how to learn your heritage language. This episode originally published May 31, 2022. Transcript

item.title: Millennial? Gen Z? It may be time for colorectal cancer screening | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Colorectal cancer cases are on the rise among people under 50. In this episode, we explain the risk, symptoms to look out for and how to get screened. Transcript

item.title: Looking for a job? Advice to help you land the gig | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description How helpful are personal connections? When should you send a thank you email? Cynthia Pong, founder and CEO of the career coaching firm Embrace Change, answers questions about how to find a job. Transcript

item.title: Dear LK: How should I talk to my kids about their incarcerated uncle? | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description My brother-in-law was convicted of murder and is serving a life sentence. We haven’t shared any of these details with our kids, ages 7 and 9. When should we tell our children where he is and what he did? Transcript

item.title: Let's have some cheap fun | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description You don’t need to spend a lot of money to have fun. Have you done a chocolate bar taste test? Hosted a themed hangout? Gone to a surprise movie night? Here are some ideas to help you save money and maximize entertainment. Transcript

item.title: Minimize your back pain while cooking | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Many of us will experience back pain at some point in our lives. It might not disappear entirely, but you can find ways to comfortably perform everyday tasks like cooking. This episode offers strategies for minimizing your pain when making a meal – like chopping and loading an oven with minimal discomfort. Transcript

item.title: Start your own business | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description It’s time to get your MBA — the easy way. We’re sharing an episode from Planet Money’s Summer School. In this lesson: Everyone has a million dollar business idea (e.g., “Shazam but for movies”), but not everyone has what it takes to be an entrepreneur. You’ll hear two case studies with founders who learned the hard way what goes into starting a small business and a biz school professor who chimes in to explain the fundamentals.

item.title: Bring more play into your life | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Play isn’t just fun. Researchers argue it can help you adapt to difficult circumstances, collaborate better and problem-solve. We’ll help you figure out your play personality and how to prioritize play in your life. Transcript

item.title: Losing a pet is hard. Here's how to cope | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Losing a pet can be devastating. Here’s how to process the loss of your special friend and open yourself up to the love and lessons they left behind. Transcript

item.title: How to make a salad you want to eat | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description We could all be eating more vegetables. One fast way to do that: toss them in a salad. Here’s how to make nutritious, affordable and most importantly, crave-worthy salads. Transcript

item.title: Find books you'll love | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Traci Thomas, host of the hit book podcast ‘The Stacks,’ shares 6 surprising tips on how to find your next great read. One tip? Don’t be afraid to judge a book by its cover. Transcript

item.title: How to be an amazing auntie or uncle | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Parents aren’t the only people who help raise kids or invest in their wellbeing. Uncles, aunties and family friends make great role models too. Transcript

item.title: How to buy a car with confidence | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Buying a car can be intimidating. This episode will help you strategize to avoid all the potential pitfalls, so you can drive away with a good deal. This episode originally published February 18, 2020. Transcript

item.title: How to tell your own story | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Everyone has a story to tell. Writing a memoir is more than just documenting your life — it can help you process what you’ve gone through, capture a moment in history for descendants and help others make sense of their own lives. Here’s how to get started. Transcript

item.title: How to choose a bank | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description It’s easy to feel stuck with a bank account you’ve had forever, even if it’s inconvenient or racking up fees. But there are lots of other options out there. Transcript

item.title: What to do when you're constipated | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description We’ve got a step-by-step guide for that SOS moment when you haven’t pooped in days and days. Transcript

item.title: Dear LK: My group chat is toxic | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description In college, I became close with a diverse friend group. Years later, we still stay in touch via text. Some people rely on our group to manage their anxiety. The norm in the group is to reassure whoever is most upset, even when that person is wrong. Transcript

item.title: Coping with a fear of flying | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Whether you’re a nervous flyer, you’ll do almost anything to avoid flying or you have an actual flying phobia, these tips from psychotherapist Luana Marques can help you overcome a fear of flying. Transcript

item.title: How to prepare for the return of student loan payments | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description The Supreme Court has decided to strike down the Biden administration’s plan to discharge some or all federal student loan debt. The decision impacts tens of millions of Americans – so what can student loan borrowers do to prepare now that the plan is over? NPR’s education correspondent Cory Turner gives context and advice for borrowers. Transcript

item.title: It's never too late to become a strong swimmer | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Knowing how to swim can help you have fun at the pool or beach this summer. But it could also save your life. Here are some tips to start swimming at any age. Transcript

item.title: How to stop overthinking romantic relationships | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Romance makes us feel vulnerable, and dating can feel high stakes. We talk about how to keep things in perspective and take care of your mental health in relationships. Transcript

item.title: Get grilling this summer | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Intimidated by grilling? Cooking over an open flame can do that! In this episode, learn which type of grill to choose, how to maintain a fire, how to create different temperature zones, and other basics and safety tips. This episode originally published May 24, 2022. Transcript

item.title: How to start running in the body you have | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Running is a classic form of exercise for a reason. It gets you from point A to point B, you don’t need equipment or a gym membership and it provides cardiovascular benefits. But many people are told that running is not for them because of their body type. We talk to Martinus Evans, author of “Slow AF Run Club,” about how you can start running in the body you have.

item.title: Ultra-processed foods are everywhere. Here's how to avoid them | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Ultra-processed foods are tasty, cheap and everywhere. But they come with health risks. NPR health correspondent Maria Godoy lays out ways to spot and avoid ultra-processed foods during your next grocery run. Transcript

item.title: Get more rest | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description It’s time to make room for more naps. Tricia Hersey, also known as the ’nap bishop’ and author of the book “Rest Is Resistance: A Manifesto,” explains why relaxation and leisure are human rights — especially for communities of color. This episode originally published October 13, 2022. Transcript

item.title: The do's and don'ts of being a plus-one | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description It’s wedding season. If you’ve been invited as a plus-one, here’s the etiquette you need to be the best guest. Transcript

item.title: How to spot AI-generated and other fake content | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description It’s easy to be fooled by AI-generated images and other content. We talk about how to identify them, how media literacy can help, plus how to use these tools responsibly. Transcript

item.title: Renting? Learn to be your own best housing advocate | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Does your landlord have to fix that leak? Should you be worried about that clause in your lease? If you live in one of the nearly 44.1 million renter households in the U.S., here’s how to spot rental red flags, learn how to speak the language of landlords and how to decode a lease. Transcript

item.title: How to protect yourself from poor air quality | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Canadian wildfires are causing poor air quality in parts of the U.S. The health effects of smoke and poor air quality are dangerous. Here’s how to stay safe when the air quality is unhealthy. Transcript

item.title: Get more out of your dreams | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Dreams have inspired works of art, led to breakthroughs in organic chemistry and helped people process their deepest fears and emotions. They’re not just weird little movies our brains put on while we sleep. In this episode, we explain why we dream — and how to get more out of them. Transcript

item.title: Why you should play video games with your kid | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Video games get a bad reputation that’s often unwarranted. But kids do need guidance in using them wisely. Here’s how to help them, starting with spending some time with the games your kids can’t put down. Transcript

item.title: Dear LK: I'm happily married but hate our sex life. Should I ask for a divorce? | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description I’ve been in a loving relationship with my husband for years. We’re incredibly compatible except for our sex life. The sex started off great, became less interesting over the years, and now it’s non-existent. I’m considering divorce even though the rest of our relationship is fine. Initiating a divorce feels cruel, but I also feel like I’m settling and watching time slip away. Transcript

item.title: To save money on groceries, try these tips before going to the store | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Groceries aren’t cheap, but there are ways beyond just looking for sales to make budget meals. To help cut down your grocery bill, we have practical tips for saving money on the food you cook at home. Transcript

item.title: Pick the right sunscreen for you | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description No matter your skin tone, sunscreen keeps your skin safe from harmful UVA and UVB rays. But to use it right, you need to know a few things: What SPF to use, how often to reapply and the difference between chemical and physical sunscreen. We explain what to look for on the back of a sunscreen bottle and how to use it effectively. Transcript

item.title: Extend the life of your clothes with visible mending | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description There’s no need to give up on a sweater with a hole in the elbow or a shirt with a tear in the collar. Visible mending is beginner friendly, highly creative and helps extend the life of your clothes. Transcript

item.title: What to do when you're feeling anxious | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Anxiety can feel awful and overwhelming. But it can also be a helpful warning signal — telling us when we’re in danger or out of alignment with our true feelings. We share tips on how to turn down the dial on your anxiety symptoms, so you can listen to what they’re trying to tell you. Transcript

item.title: How to have healthy dating expectations | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Dating in search of “the one”? Relationship therapist Jeff Guenther, known as Therapy Jeff on TikTok, says that might not be practical. If your goal is a successful, long-term partnership, having realistic expectations and a clear understanding of your values is vital. We’ll help you break up with your fantasy partner, do some relationship math and learn what it takes to build a successful partnership based in reality.

item.title: Making friends anywhere you move | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Whether you’re moving into a summer sublet or your forever home, friendships are important to feeling settled in a new place. So how do we do that? A friendship coach walks us through how we can be more vulnerable and resourceful in adult friendships. Transcript

item.title: Create a better to-do list | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Is your to-do list helping you reach your goals? Or is it holding you back? Productivity experts explain how to level up your list so it prioritizes what matters to you. This episode originally published Jan. 5, 2023. Transcript

item.title: Thrifting 101: Your guide to finding quality pieces | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Shopping secondhand is a good way to be more sustainable, explore your personal style or score a deal. We have tips from some diehard thrifters so you can find those hidden gems. Transcript

item.title: Pregnant? Here's how to deal with the new you | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Pregnancy is hard work – for the body, mind and soul. There are seemingly endless resources for all the physical and logistical aspects of pregnancy but far fewer for renegotiating your sense of self. Life Kit spoke with author and journalist Chelsea Conaboy about how pregnancy impacts the brain and how to embrace the changes that parenthood brings. Transcript

item.title: 5 ways to improve your indoor air quality | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Want fresher, cleaner air at home? We share practical tips from researchers on how to clean your house (and your air), test your air quality, and change your habits to limit indoor air pollution. Transcript

item.title: 5 ways to explore your gender identity | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description If you’re an adult starting to explore your gender identity, it can be tough knowing where to begin. Here’s some advice from trans people to help you on this intimate and powerful journey. Transcript

item.title: Dear LK: My parents pay my tuition. Do I have to show them my grades? | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description If your parents pay for your college, do they have a right to demand to see your grades? Berna Anat, the author of Money Out Loud, shares advice on defining financial expectations and boundaries. Transcript

item.title: A better way to talk to your doctor | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Ever leave the doctor’s office confused or with unanswered questions? Talking to doctors and other medical professionals can be hard — whether they’re good at their jobs or not. We’ll give you the tools to get more out of your appointments. We’ll talk about how to choose a provider, prepare for your visit, ask the right questions, and get your provider’s attention if they’re not hearing you. To support our work at NPR and listen to the show sponsor-free, sign up for Life Kit+ at plus.

item.title: Want to create a stronger bond with your kids? First relinquish control | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description It may sound counterintuitive, but if you want to take charge as a parent, stop trying to control your child, says psychologist and author Shefali Tsabary. Her new book, “The Parenting Map,” lays out a step-by-step guide for creating conscious parent-child relationships. Transcript

item.title: When a partner keeps a financial secret | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description How do you cope when your partner keeps a secret that impacts your personal finances? Meredith Goldstein of the Love Letters podcast from The Boston Globe talks with a couple who worked through financial troubles in their marriage that threatened their hard-earned sense of security. Transcript

item.title: How to break up with your therapist | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Getting into therapy comes with its own hurdles, but what about knowing when to stop it? Moraya Seeger DeGeare, a licensed marriage and family therapist, has advice on how to figure out when it’s time to end therapy and what actually to say when you do. Depending on the situation, ending with your therapist could involve anything from ghosting to a sit-down conversation. Transcript

item.title: A field guide for fledgling birders | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description You don’t need binoculars and a trip to a nature preserve to go birding. If you’ve ever paused to appreciate a bird, you’re already well on your way. Here are some tips to up your game. Transcript

item.title: Put your savings to work | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description The current inflation rate in the US is 5 percent. And most big bank savings accounts offer interest rates much lower than that. In this episode, you’ll learn how to protect your savings against inflation. Transcript

item.title: How to clean when you don't feel like cleaning | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Therapist and author KC Davis shares a framework to help you get a messy room back to functional quickly. She says that in any space, there are really only five things: trash, dishes, laundry, things that have a place, and things that don’t have a place. We help you tackle them, one by one. Transcript

item.title: Your guide to running for office | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description If you’ve ever thought about running for office — your town council or school board, the state legislature, or even Congress, this episode is for you. We’ll tell you where to start and how to navigate everything from campaign fundraising to building a “kitchen cabinet.” This episode was originally published on October 17, 2019. Transcript

item.title: So you don't want kids. How to build a child-free life | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description If you’ve decided not to have kids, your life will look different from what you might have seen growing up. Here’s how to build your child-free life, with or without a long-term partner. We talk about finding community, planning for the future, making a financial plan and responding to some of the comments and judgments of other people. Transcript

item.title: Find your way to a (high-paying) trade job | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description There are lots of jobs that don’t require a bachelor’s degree and pay well. Here’s what to consider if you’re thinking about a job in the trades — from assessing your options to choosing a training program. This episode originally published April 26, 2021. Transcript

item.title: Get your debt under control | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Life happens, and so does debt. Unexpected car trouble, the high price of food, a family emergency — there is no shortage of reasons why debt can pile up. In this episode, we offer shame-free solutions for digging out of debt. Transcript

item.title: Practicing the art of saying goodbye | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Saying goodbye can be tough, especially if you’re parting ways for good. But grief counselor and patient advocate Isabel Stenzel Byrnes says the art of saying goodbye to loved ones can be learned and practiced. Transcript

item.title: Dear LK: My boyfriend's parents pay for everything. It makes me uncomfortable | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description She loves her boyfriend’s parents, but their generosity feels inappropriate. Maya Lau, host of the podcast Other People’s Pockets, weighs in on how to move forward. Transcript

item.title: Tips for acing that job interview | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description How should you prepare in advance for a job interview? We discuss what questions to prep for, how to choose an outfit you feel your best in, and what to do if you get nervous. Plus, we walk through a mock interview to model how to answer common questions. Transcript

item.title: Planning a trip? Here's how to pack like a pro | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Getting ready for a trip is fun until you have to start packing. These tips for packing a carry-on will help you figure out what you need in your bag (and what you don’t!) so you can have peace of mind while traveling. Transcript

item.title: How to show up for teens when big emotions arise | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Being a teenager is hard. There are emotional highs and lows every day. Clinical psychologist Lisa Damour says instead of jumping into problem-solving mode, parents can learn to ride the wave of emotional management with their teens. NPR’s Rachel Martin speaks with Damour about her book “The Emotional Lives of Teenagers.” Transcript

item.title: Tips for negotiating your medical bills | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description There’s an estimated $195 billion of medical debt in America. But just because a medical bill comes in the mail doesn’t mean you have to pay that exact price. Here’s how to eliminate, reduce or negotiate a medical bill. Transcript

item.title: 6 tips for raising happy houseplants | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description From monstera to snake plants, we’ll walk you through how to care for your houseplants properly. Plus, troubleshooting tips for knowing when your plant needs water and how to get rid of pests. Transcript

item.title: How an aerialist uses trapeze to teach students about consent | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description How do we learn to trust what our bodies tell us and express it to others? Aerialist Adie Delaney speaks with TED Radio Hour host Manoush Zomorodi about how communication, trust and safety in trapeze can provide valuable lessons on consent. Transcript

item.title: 5 things to remember when a friendship ends | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Not all friends are meant to last forever. Here are 5 things to remember if you’re processing the loss of a friendship — or trying to save one that matters to you. Transcript

item.title: How to have the STIs conversation | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description With Dr. Evalene Dacker, we lay out the science of STIs and then give you language to talk about them and, more broadly, about sex, with a potential partner. Because for something so fun, sex can be hard to talk about. Transcript

item.title: Tricks to boost your credit score | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description A strong credit score can make major purchases and financial transactions much easier. Here’s how to make yours better and keep it high. (This episode originally ran in November 2020.) Transcript

item.title: Masculinity doesn't have to be restrictive. Here's how to redefine it for yourself | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Restrictive expectations of masculinity can be perpetuated by anyone and impact how we view ourselves and others. We spoke with experts for tips on how you or those in your life can begin to redefine masculinity. Transcript

item.title: 5 questions to ask your partner before getting hitched | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description These conversation starters get at the heart of your values, including how you deal with conflict, your attitude toward gender roles and your relationship with money. Transcript

item.title: Braving the 'quarterlife' crisis | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Stuck between two conflicting desires and can’t seem to move forward? Psychotherapist Satya Doyle Byock shares an exercise called “My Two Conflicting Selves” to help people find a compromise. (This episode originally ran in October 17, 2022). Transcript

item.title: Finding joy in the face of sorrow | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Poet Ross Gay knows a thing or two about finding joy in life’s most difficult moments. He talks with It’s Been a Minute host Brittany Luse about his new book of essays, “Inciting Joy” — which covers the complexity of joy, the beauty of grace, and meaning in life. Transcript

item.title: So you want to be a mentor | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we talk about who can be a mentor, how to structure the relationship, and how to have tricky conversations with your mentees. Also, how to make sure it’s not a one-sided relationship. Transcript

item.title: The truth about caffeine | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description 75% of Americans consume some kind of caffeine at least once a day. Whether your caffeine of choice is coffee, tea, soda or energy drinks, how do you know that it’s working for you and not against you? We speak with experts about how you can assess your relationship to caffeine and explore why caffeine may not deserve its bad reputation. Transcript

item.title: This is the period talk you should've gotten | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description We asked two experts how they would give the period talk. Here are six pieces of advice — including the science of periods, management techniques, and how to know when something is wrong. Transcript

item.title: Dear Life Kit: Do I have to listen to my boss complain? | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description An employee struggles to cope with her boss’s constant oversharing and negativity. Journalist and host of the podcast Work Appropriate Anne Helen Petersen shares advice for establishing boundaries … with your boss. Transcript

item.title: Can I afford to quit my job? | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Longing to quit your job and follow your passion? Or perhaps take a break to travel? Or move to a new place? First, you’ll need to look at your finances. In this episode, Jill Schlesinger, a certified financial planner and business analyst for CBS News, walks through her five steps for assessing your financial situation before a possible life change. Transcript

item.title: 'Do I really need to floss?' and other common questions about dental care | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description We asked experts to answer five questions about how to properly care for your teeth. Here’s what they said about finding a dentist, whitening your teeth at home, and whether daily flossing is necessary. Transcript

item.title: How to file your tax returns: 6 things you should know this year | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description For something that’s legally required, taxes can be confusing. This guide explains when and how to hire a tax preparer, covers the latest credits and deductions — and helps you plan ahead for next year. Transcript

item.title: Define your personal style | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Fashion may not have been at the top of your priority list over the last two years. If you’re ready to shake the dust off, here’s advice from the experts — from purging your closet to taking fashion risks in a way that feels true to you. Transcript

item.title: How caregivers can prevent burnout | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description 1 in 5 Americans are acting as unpaid caregivers. The work can be meaningful but also stressful. Caregivers give advice about how to approach the job, find support and make time for yourself. Transcript

item.title: Earthquake preparedness in 6 steps | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Earthquakes strike at a moment’s notice. That’s why having a plan in place is key. In this episode, emergency and disaster experts share their tips to help prepare you and your family. Transcript

item.title: The science of finding a partner | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Logan Ury, a behavioral scientist at the dating app Hinge, says making dating decisions based on initial chemistry alone is a losing battle. In this episode, dating coach Damon Hoffman speaks with Ury about her book, How to Not Die Alone. Transcript

item.title: Why the 5-minute walk break is so powerful | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Sitting all day isn’t good for your health. Long stretches glued to a chair can increase the risk of heart disease and early death. Thankfully, new research shows that five minute walk breaks can be powerful in offsetting those risks. Transcript

item.title: Dear LK: My husband is still living under COVID lockdown | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Three years into the pandemic, one spouse is ready to lift lockdown. The other? Not so much. Epidemiologist and science communicator Jessica Malaty Rivera shares ideas on finding compromise and managing a risk budget. Transcript

item.title: Creative ways to get kids to eat their veggies | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Veggies help kids grow and develop, but it can be hard to convince them to eat their broccoli. These research-backed tips can help you encourage your kids to eat more veggies — or at least try them. Transcript

item.title: Budgeting for dating | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description How much should you spend on a date? Who should pick up the bill? Can you talk money on the first date? Kristin Myers, editor-in-chief of The Balance, shares the results of a recent survey on finances and dating. Transcript

item.title: Be an awesome gift giver | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Searching for the perfect gift for a loved one doesn’t have to be stressful. With some clever thinking, buying a present can be even more fun that receiving one. ‘SELF magazine’ editor-in-chief Rachel Wilkerson Miller shares her best tips for birthdays, Valentine’s Day or any other occasion. Transcript

item.title: Meal prep made easy | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description What’s for dinner? It’s a question that can lead to overspending on delivery, unhealthy meals and dread. FitMenCook founder Kevin Curry shares meal prep techniques that can alleviate stress and save money. Transcript

item.title: The five kinds of perfectionists | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Are you a ‘Parisian perfectionist’? How about a ‘messy perfectionist’? Psychotherapist Katherine Morgan Schafler believes there are 5 kinds of perfectionists in the world. Find out which one you are. Transcript

item.title: Dear LK: My kids are enemies. What should I do? | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description ​A sister relentlessly picks on her brother despite their mom’s best attempt to make peace between them. Psychologist Becky Kennedy shares advice with a parent who feels out of ideas — and patience. Transcript

item.title: Helpful financial advice for creative types | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Got a side hustle and not sure how to handle your money? Financial coach Paco de Leon, author of ‘Finance for the People: Getting a Grip on Your Finances,’ explains why you should put your freelance funds into a separate bank account and how to prepare yourself for tax season. Transcript

item.title: Practical tips for exercising in the cold | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Athlete and activist Alison Mariella Désir and sports medicine specialist Dr. Kelechi Okoroha explain how runners should dress when temperatures drop to the 50s, 30s and below. Transcript

item.title: 'Terrestrials,' a new kid's show from Radiolab, uncovers the strangeness on Earth | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description This is the story of one particularly devious octopus who lost a limb, was captured by humans — then managed to make an escape from its aquarium tank back into the ocean. This episode comes from our friends at ‘Terrestrials,’ a podcast presented by Radiolab for Kids. Transcript

item.title: Looking for a job? Advice to help you land the gig | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description How helpful are personal connections? When should you send a thank you email? Cynthia Pong, founder and CEO of the career coaching firm Embrace Change, answers questions about how to find a job now. Transcript

item.title: Pushing back against 'anti-fatness' | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description All Things Considered host Juana Summers interviews Aubrey Gordon, author of the book " ‘You Just Need To Lose Weight’: And 19 Other Myths About Fat People." Gordon explains how the concept of ‘anti-fatness’ keeps fat people on the margins of society. Transcript

item.title: How to reduce your climate footprint in 2023 | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Lowering individual greenhouse emissions may be easier than you think. Here are some New Year’s resolutions experts agree have an impact in addressing climate change. Transcript

item.title: Dear LK: I'm tired of my boyfriend's lack of ambition | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Can you successfully motivate someone else to change? Clinical psychologist Jody Adewale shares advice with a letter writer feels put off by her partner’s lack of direction. Transcript

item.title: How to look at art (and have a perception-altering experience) | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Everyone can have a profound connection with a work of art. You just need the right mindset and attitude. Art professionals share tips on how to navigate museums and observe paintings and sculptures. Transcript

item.title: Find your authentic personal brand | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Life Kit’s Andee Tagle talks to networking coach Lynda Peralta about how to present her personal life and her professional life on Instagram. See how her experiment went, then try it out for yourself. Transcript

item.title: How to make a better to-do list | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Is your to-do list helping you reach your goals? Or is it holding you back? Productivity experts explain how to level up your list so it prioritizes what matters. Transcript

item.title: Clear out your clutter | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Got piles of stuff you just can’t seem to get rid of? Professional organizer Star Hansen explains how to let go of unnecessary items – and keep your home neat and tidy. Transcript

item.title: New Year's resolutions from Life Kit | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Happy New Year! Team members at Life Kit share some of their favorite tips they are looking to trying in 2023, from how to start an art habit to how to get kids to listen better. For more great New Year’s resolution ideas, check out npr.org/newyears. Transcript

item.title: How to start an exercise routine that works for you | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description You don’t have to be a marathoner or gym rat to get meaningful health benefits from exercise. In fact, that die-hard mentality can actually deter you from getting movement. Here’s how to start a fitness routine that you’ll actually stick to. Transcript

item.title: Ready to make a change for New Year's? Behavioral science can help | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description When is the best time to start a new habit? And why are some habits easier to practice than others? Behavioral scientist Katy Milkman, author of ‘How to Change,’ explains how to get a behavior to stick. Transcript

item.title: This acronym will help you give the perfect toast | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description It’s the wild card of every big event — the toast. Done well, it can be a memorable highlight. Done badly, it can be a total cringefest. Here’s a helpful way to remember how to give a terrific toast, whether it’s at a New Year’s party or at wedding reception. Transcript

item.title: How to help someone at risk of suicide | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description If you know someone struggling with despair, depression or thoughts of suicide, you may be wondering how to help. Psychologists and researchers explain how to recognize the warning signs and what to do and say when a loved one is in crisis. Transcript

item.title: How to be a better movie watcher, according to film critics | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description This guide — which comes with a fun brochure you can download and print at home — offers advice on how to pick a film, get outside your comfort zone and deepen your enjoyment of movies. Transcript

item.title: How to cut down your alcohol intake | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Want to skip the champagne and cocktails this holiday season? Here’s how to take a break from drinking alcohol — including in social settings — and start healthy habits. Transcript

item.title: Can therapy save their friendship? | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Would you ever consider going to therapy with a friend? In this episode from NPR Invisibilia, two best friends — who are so close they call themselves brothers — were drifting apart, so host Yowei Shaw asked psychotherapist Esther Perel to help. This episode was recorded in collaboration with Perel’s podcast, Where Should We Begin? Transcript

item.title: Dear LK: We bought a dog instead of rescuing one. It cost me a friend | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description An ideological difference over adopting versus shopping for a pet causes a rift between friends. Tania Israel, a professor of psychology, shares advice about how to have difficult conversations with people you care about. Transcript

item.title: How to support people with long COVID | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description One in five Americans who have had COVID have experienced symptoms lasting three months or more. How can patients navigate this chronic illness? And how can the people in their lives provide comfort and strength? In this episode from our friends at It’s Been a Minute, host Brittany Luse talks to the editor and a contributor of a new book, ‘The Long COVID Survival Guide.’ Transcript

item.title: Build a healthy relationship with your in-laws | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Creating a relationship with your partner’s family can be hard work. Experts share how to navigate 5 tricky situations, including dealing with in-laws who can’t seem to stop giving unsolicited advice. Transcript

item.title: How to start new traditions that feel right to you | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Traditions can foster a sense of unity with the people we love and help pass down cultural values. But what happens when these events no longer make sense in our lives? Transcript

item.title: Piece together your family tree | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description If you’re interested in learning more about your family history, genealogist Mica Anders says to get creative. Look through newspaper archives, census data, vital records and more. And who knows, you may find some unexpected gems in the process. Transcript

item.title: Stressed about talking about finances with a new partner? This framework can help | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description It can be awkward to discuss money when you’re in a new relationship. Financial therapist Amanda Clayman suggests following what she calls the “five components of financial intimacy” to get the conversation started. Transcript

item.title: Dear LK: My folks guilt-trip me into spending the holidays with them | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Between long-held traditions, unfair expectations and clashing personalities, the holidays can be a perfect storm for conflict. Therapist John Kim helps untangle three holiday conundrums. Transcript

item.title: How to apply the rules of improv to everyday life | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Improv comedy is about more than making people laugh. It can help performers be more creative and self-assured — and combat anxiety, both on and off stage. Transcript

item.title: Transform the way you deal with dread | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Worried about deadlines, errands or your holiday to-do list? Reframe your relationship with dread with these simple exercises, from drawing the things that scare you to scheduling worry time. Transcript

item.title: How much money do you need to become a parent? An episode from This Is Uncomfortable | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description A couple clashes about how much money they need to save before having children. This episode is from our friends This Is Uncomfortable’s podcast series on fights about money. Transcript

item.title: How to set boundaries with family | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Maintaining healthy boundaries is a way of taking care of your closest relationships, but setting those boundaries can be hard. The process starts with asking yourself what you need. (This episode originally ran in January 2021.) Transcript

item.title: Make holiday travel less stressful | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description There will probably be long lines, delays and overbooked flights, says aviation journalist Benét Wilson. So take steps to prepare for these situations and make the journey a little more pleasant. Transcript

item.title: Get better at being grateful | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Being thankful doesn’t have to happen just once a year. Here are two meaningful ways to show gratitude all year long, a practice that can improve your mental and physical health. Transcript

item.title: Dear LK: My boyfriend is too close with his former coworker | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description My partner is constantly texting his former coworker and even spent the night at her house. He says they’re just friends, but I don’t like it. How can I trust him when he ignores my boundaries? Transcript

item.title: Michelle Obama's philosophy on relationships | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description In her new memoir, ‘The Light We Carry,’ the former first lady shares her philosophy on the relationships we have with our partner, our family and ourselves. ‘You have to evolve with it,’ she says. Transcript

item.title: How to deepen your connection with your ancestors | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Your ancestors don’t have to feel like a distant memory. Spiritual practitioners share cross-cultural guidance on how to set up a ritual and an altar to honor them at home. Transcript

item.title: How to rethink the way you spend your time — and life | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Assuming you live to be eighty, you have just 4,000 weeks to live. While that may come as a brutal dose of reality, it’s also an opportunity to think about how you’re spending that time. Transcript

item.title: Life Kit answers your pressing questions about inflation | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description The prices of goods and services have gone up. How much of that is due to Ukraine or the pandemic? What can our elected officials do to lower prices? And how does inflation slow down? NPR’s Marielle Segarra and Stacey Vanek Smith tackle listener queries. Transcript

item.title: Credit card points are for everyone. Here's how to get into them | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Credit card rewards programs can offer big perks like airline miles and hotel upgrades. Finance journalist Katherine Fan explains how to choose the right card and what to know before signing up. Transcript

item.title: Dear LK: My son is upset his brother didn't make him best man. Should I intervene? | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description A mother debates whether she should talk to the groom about the issue. Catherine Newman, an etiquette columnist for Real Simple magazine, gives her advice. Transcript

item.title: Mexican cooking 101 | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Want to start making authentic Mexican cuisine at home? Here’s what you’ll need in your pantry and your fridge to get started, according to two Mexican chefs and cookbook authors. Transcript

item.title: How to stay safe during a night out | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Safety experts explain how to prevent harm in nightlife settings like bars and clubs. That includes how to project an air of confidence with your body language — and how to effectively say “no.” Transcript

item.title: How to throw a clever theme party | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Party planning experts say to send out invites at least 6 weeks in advance. That can give guests ample time to mark their social calendars — and prepare for the big bash. Read on for more tips. Transcript

item.title: How to wake up early, even if you're a night owl | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Waking up at dawn with the bakers and the baristas may not be for everyone — especially night owls. Whether you have to wake up early or you’d like to become more of a morning lark, here are a few habits that can help you set yourself up for success at that first alarm. (This episode originally ran in November 2021.) Transcript

item.title: Student loan forgiveness Q&A | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Life Kit teams up with NPR Education to answer some common questions about student loan relief, including: What’s the application process like? What loans qualify for debt relief? What if you have multiple loans? Transcript

item.title: Dear LK: I cared for our dad. Now my greedy siblings want the inheritance | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description She cared for her stepdad through illness and death. Now she’s disheartened that her siblings only seem to care about the inheritance. Financial therapist Lindsay Bryan-Podvin weighs in. Transcript

item.title: Braving the 'quarterlife' crisis | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Stuck between two conflicting desires and can’t seem to move forward? Psychotherapist Satya Doyle Byock shares an exercise called “My Two Conflicting Selves” to help people find a compromise. Transcript

item.title: The 5-minute daily playtime ritual that can get your kids to listen better | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Called “special time,” the strategy is widely recommended by children’s health professionals to help reduce behavioral issues in young children. Here’s a guide on how to do it with your kids at home. Transcript

item.title: How to use music to express your authentic self | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description For R&B darling Omar Apollo, music has been a powerful way to showcase his Mexican American culture and queer identity. In an episode with NPR’s Alt.Latino, he explains why that takes courage and confidence — and a little soul-searching too. Transcript

item.title: Why rest is an act of resistance | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Known to her fans as the ’nap bishop,’ Tricia Hersey, author of the new book ‘Rest Is Resistance: A Manifesto,’ explains why relaxation and leisure are a human right — especially for communities of color. Transcript

item.title: Tips for finding relief from IBS | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description More than 25 million Americans have Irritable Bowel Syndrome. While IBS symptoms present in the gut, it turns out that stress and anxiety can actually exacerbate symptoms. Here’s how to identify triggers for IBS, eat a diet that decreases gas and bloating — and learn where to seek help. Transcript

item.title: How to recreate a beloved family recipe | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Step 1? Throw your expectations out the window, says NPR’s Noor Wazwaz. Your dish won’t be the same as the one you grew up eating — and that’s OK. Here’s how to add your own unique spin to a family dish and pass on it on to the next generation. Transcript

item.title: Dear LK: Should I give my boyfriend an ultimatum? | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Pop musician and reality dating series host Betty Who gives advice to a letter writer who asks if she should give her boyfriend an ultimatum because she’s ready to move in together — and he isn’t. Transcript

item.title: Protect yourself from election disinformation | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description It’s almost time to vote. NPR’s Miles Parks explains what research can tell us about how to combat fake political news — and why it’s so tricky to separate fact from fiction. Transcript

item.title: How to start professional networking (and feel good about it) | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Networking expert Robbie Samuels explains why adapting the attitude of a croissant is more likely to create meaningful job connections — and shares ways to make networking feel more natural. Transcript

item.title: The markets are down. Here's how to handle your investments | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description About 60% of Americans have some money in the stock market — and the markets are not doing great. Your knee-jerk reaction might be to sell. But experts explain why that’s not a good idea. Transcript

item.title: Dear LK: My dad's wife died and he won't leave the house | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Psychotherapist David Defoe offers advice to a letter writer who is concerned about how to help their grieving father. Transcript

item.title: What to do when driving during flood conditions | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Hurricane Ian is rapidly intensifying, and with that there are predicted storm surges of up to 18 feet. We’ll walk you through how you can to stay safe during heavy rain on the road. Transcript

item.title: When something feels personal, here's how to cope | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Being offended by something that someone did or said can be upsetting — but it doesn’t have to eat away at us. Mental health experts share how to slow down and gain clarity when things get personal. Transcript

item.title: When it comes to parenting, lead with connection | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description It all starts with the assumption that your kids have good intentions and want to do the right thing, says Becky Kennedy, a psychologist and host of the Good Inside parenting podcast. Transcript

item.title: Dear LK: My parents ran a background check on my boyfriend | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description A daughter tries to rebuild trust with her parents after they secretly ran a background check on her boyfriend. Therapist and author Nedra Glover Tawwab shares insight on how to move forward. Transcript

item.title: How much water does your body really need? | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Do you really need to drink eight glasses of water a day? Can drinking water help you lose weight? Does coffee dehydrate you? Experts explain the science of hydration. Transcript

item.title: Stuck doing all the household chores? This practical guide can help | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description In four steps, experts Eve Rodsky and Jacqueline Misla explain how to fairly split domestic work with a partner or roommate. Don’t forget to print out the handy zine! Transcript

item.title: How to start a new job | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Life Kit host Marielle Segarra asks friends and family for advice on how to overcome her new-job jitters, meet new colleagues at NPR — and stay confident. Transcript

item.title: Dear LK: Do I have to read the book my husband wrote? | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description What’s more, the letter writer hates her husband’s writing style. Should she bite the bullet and read his novel? Or can she pass? Family therapist Kiaundra Jackson offers her two cents. Transcript

item.title: How to counteract common thinking traps | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Humans have a tendency to make snap judgments and assumptions due to our cognitive biases, says Woo-kyoung Ahn in her book ‘Thinking 101.’ So how do we fight them? Transcript

item.title: A friendship expert shares the science of making and keeping friends | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Psychologist Marisa Franco, author of a new book on the science of making and keeping friends, shares how to deepen the bonds in our platonic relationships. Transcript

item.title: The omicron boosters are here. What you should know about them | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description They target the original coronavirus strain and the omicron subvariants causing most of the current infections. And they’re available at pharmacies, clinics and doctors’ offices around the country. Should you get one? And if so, when? Transcript

item.title: Dear LK: I uninvited my sister-in-law from our wedding | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description The bride said she was “pissed” because her future sister-in-law was bringing two unauthorized guests. Rachel Wilkerson Miller, editor-in-chief of Self magazine, explains how to smooth things over. Transcript

item.title: How to gamify your exercise routine | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Exercising doesn’t have to feel like a chore if you approach it like a video game, say fitness gamification researchers Dr. Mitesh Patel and Elizabeth Lyons. Strategies to have fun while staying active. Transcript

item.title: 3 tips for talking to your Latinx parents about mental health | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Shame and stigma play a huge role in discouraging folks in the Latinx community from seeking mental health care — and talking about it with their families. These steps can help you prepare for the conversation with your loved ones. (This episode originally aired in February 2022.) Transcript

item.title: Simplify dinner (and cleanup) with these clever one-pan meals | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description NPR’s Ayesha Rascoe talks to food writer Melissa Clark about her new book, “Dinner in One: Exceptional & Easy One-Pan Meals” — and gets tips on how to cook flavorsome weeknight dinners without a sink full of dirty dishes. Transcript

item.title: Dear LK: My co-worker posted a terrible review about me! | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description A secretary asks if she should tattle-tale on a colleague who wrote an anonymous negative review about her. Career coach and HR professional Shanita Williams weighs in on the conundrum. Transcript

item.title: Learning a new skill can be easy — if you have the right mindset | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Mastering a new hobby, like bowling or baking, can be a frustrating process. But experts say it doesn’t have to be that way. If you set yourself up for success at the start and allow yourself to make mistakes — you can improve your chances of sticking with it. Transcript

item.title: The sex ed most queer students never got | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description School health classes in the U.S. rarely include instruction about sex for LGBTQ students. Here’s what it could look like if they did. (This episode originally aired in April 2021 and was updated in August 2022.) Transcript

item.title: 4 exercises that can prevent (and relieve!) pain from computer slouching and more | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Vinh Pham, physical therapist and author of “Sit Up Straight: Futureproof Your Body Against Chronic Pain with 12 Simple Movements,” explains why mobility exercises and good posture may be your best defense against muscle and joint pain. Transcript

item.title: What is 988? And is it safe to call? What to know about the new mental health hotline | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description When the 988 Suicide & Crisis Lifeline launched in July, some advocates and people who had experiences with the mental health system voiced concerns about 988. Life Kit talks to Aneri Patani, national health correspondent with Kaiser Health News, about how the hotline works, its purpose and the potential risks of calling 988. Transcript

item.title: How to transition to natural hair — and learn to love it | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description For many Black people, transitioning to natural hair can feel frustrating, especially if you’re doing it for the first time. Experts share what you need to know about growing out natural hair, from washing it and styling it – to learning to love it. Transcript

item.title: How to deal with online harassment — and protect yourself from future attacks | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description If you’re posting frequently on social media, there’s a chance that someday, one of those posts may make you a target of online harassment. Digital security expert Harlo Holmes and artist and independent researcher Ra’il I’nasah Kiam share tips on what to do if that happens — and how to tighten up your privacy online. Transcript

item.title: Why being resilient might matter less than you think | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Is the ability to endure hardship and adapt to difficult life situations always a good thing? Psychotherapist and licensed clinical social worker Lourdes Dolores Follins revisits the concept of resilience — and explains why it’s OK to let yourself feel angry or frustrated sometimes. Transcript

item.title: How to make the perfect playlist | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description So you’re planning the perfect candlelit evening — or the perfect road trip, or the perfect afternoon at home. Where do you start? A playlist, of course. NPR Music’s Bobby Carter showed us how he crafts them. (This episode originally ran in December 2020.) Transcript

item.title: The power in embracing your sadness | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description In the U.S., there’s a relentless focus on positivity. But as we all know, with life comes death — and with happiness, sadness. Susan Cain, author of Bittersweet: How Sorrow and Longing Make Us Whole, opens our eyes to the transformative power of melancholy. Transcript

item.title: How to protect yourself from inflation | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description High inflation and a possible recession is making life more expensive. Washington Post personal finance columnist Michelle Singletary explains how to manage debt as interest rates increase and prepare for an economic downturn. Transcript

item.title: Survival 101 with Bear Grylls | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Survivalist and adventurer Bear Grylls shares his advice on facing fear, preparing for the worst and the power of courage to get you through any situation. Transcript

item.title: How to move in with your partner | Life Kit
item.description: Podcast Description Deciding to move in with a partner can be an exciting step. Cohabitating can also be challenging and bring up anxieties. Here’s what to think about — and discuss — before you decide to move in together. Transcript

item.title: How to take better (and more distinctive) photos on vacation | Life Kit
